questiontext.text:
Exercise


By writing \(\ln x\) as \(1\cdot \ln x\) find

\({\displaystyle\int \ln x\, dx}= \) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

Oppave


Ved å skrive \(\ln x\) som \(1\cdot \ln x\), regn ut

\({\displaystyle\int \ln x\, dx}= \) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]

generalfeedback.text:
We apply integraton by parts: \[
\int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]
or alternatively: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int
g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

We are given the integral \({\displaystyle\int {@exp5@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

We have \( f(x) = {@f5@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g5@}.\)

Hence:

\(\begin{align} \int {@exp5@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f5@} \int {@g5@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df5@} \cdot \int {@g5@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f5* intg5@}- \int {@df5*intg5@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta5@}. \end{align}\)

Vi bruker delvis integrasjon: \[
\int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\]
alternativt: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int
g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]

Vi har integralet \({\displaystyle\int {@exp5@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

Velger så \( f(x) = {@f5@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g5@}.\)

Dermed blir:

\(\begin{align} \int {@exp5@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f5@} \int {@g5@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df5@} \cdot \int {@g5@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f5* intg5@}- \int {@df5*intg5@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta5@}. \end{align}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
